Tomorrow marks the beginning of Ohio‚Äôs sales tax holiday weekend. This relatively new annual tradition allows Ohio families to purchase school supplies and clothing for the upcoming school year without having to pay sales tax. I advocated for sales tax holidays long before I was elected to Congress. In fact, I led a grassroots effort to introduce the concept of this temporary tax relief in the state legislature in 2009. I‚Äôm glad to see it‚Äôs happening annually now for all Ohioans. Make sure to take advantage of the savings before the end of this weekend‚Ä¶and if possible, try to support a local small business at the same time!

In a letter to his wife, Abigail, John Adams wrote:
¬†
‚ÄúI am apt to believe that it (Independence Day) will be celebrated by succeeding generations as the great anniversary festival. It ought to be commemorated as the day of deliverance, by solemn acts of devotion to God Almighty. It ought to be solemnized with pomp and parade, with shows, games, sports, guns, bells, bonfires, and illuminations, from one end of this continent to the other, from this time forward forever more.‚Äù
¬†
Adams' words were prophetic‚Ä¶.today is a call for all Americans to reflect on our great experiment that began nearly 250 years ago, and to remember that our unalienable rights of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness are granted by our Creator, not government.¬† Happy Independence Day!

Today, thankfully, the US Supreme Court struck down President Biden‚Äôs proposed student loan bailout program.

Now, I don‚Äôt wish the burden of debt on anyone‚Ä¶trust me, I‚Äôve been there myself. But the federal government has no right to transfer the financial burden of a person‚Äôs decision to take out a loan onto American taxpayers who had no input on that decision.
